alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Grainger (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 2:25PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CLAIBORNE...WESTERN HAWKINS...WESTERN HANCOCK AND NORTHEASTERN GRAINGER COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tazewell, or 7 miles north of Rutledge, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rogersville, Sneedville, Rutledge, New Tazewell, Bean Station, Tazewell, Lone Mountain, Howard Quarter, Thorn Hill, and Evanston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
